PTEXT.TEXT: TitleKulot saka Nauhay ParagraphMain akina êt mihay istorya ya tungkol a êt ha Ayta haka nauhay. I have another story that is again about the Ayta and the straight­haired people.Hato kanon unan panaon, ay pare-parehon nauhay ya habot tamo. It's said that back in the early days, our hair was just the same as straight-haired people.. Kabay napihabian lan manan toa ya main hilan daygên ya mihay makapaêpapah. So the ancestors discussed that they would do something - something surprising.Nahên atsi hila ngan bayro ha pagtsiponan la, ay hinabi nan hatsi mihay manan tao ya wana," Main kitamon daygên ta+êmên a pare-pareho ya habot tamo." When they were all there at their meeting place, this one ancestor said, "We will do something so that our hair will not be just the same.Noa, main nangotang ya wana," Hinoy daygên tamo êmên mag-in kulot ya habot?" But someone asked, "What will we do so that (our) hair will become curly?Hinabi nan hatoy toa, ya wana," Loway pamilian hên balang miha kantamo. The elder said, what he said is, "Two (things) each one of us will choose from.No hinoy muwayo do ha kulot-kulotan, ay mag-in kulot ya. Whoever runs there to the curly plant, he will become curly-haired.No hino etaman ya muwayo do ha yabot, ay a maano ya habot na ta mag-in yaynan mauhay hên angga-angga. But whoever runs there to the cogon grass, his hair will not be affected and he will then become straight-haired forever.Kabay mag-ihip-ihip kaw no anto kaw mabay." So think over where you want (to go)."Kabay balang miha ay nag-ihip-ihip no antoy payuên la. So each one thought over where they would run to.Nahên nayari hilan nag-ihip, ay hinabi naynan hatoy toa," Mamilang akon anggan tatlo, bayo miagnan kitamon muwayo. When they had finished deciding, the elder said, "I will count to three, then we will all run.Miha, lowa, tatlo." One, two, three."Pagkayari nan namilang ay nuwayo hilaynay kal-atan. When he had finished counting, then they all ran.Main nunta ha kulot-kulotan. Some went to the curly plant.Main etaman êt ya nunta ha yabot. But others went to the cogon grass.Nahên nayari anay habayto, ay nuli hilayna êt. When that was finished, they went back home.Noa, a ya pon tambêng nag-in kulot ya habot la. But their hair didn't become curly right away.Nahên nunta hilayna ha obra la, ya balang miha, ay kaban ampag-obra hila ay ampakakanawa yaynan ampangulêtên ya habot lan hatoy nayo ha kulot-kulotan. When they went to their work, each one as they worked, little by little their hair was now curling, those who ran to the curly plant.Kabay nangubat bayro ay main ana hên kulot. So from then on, there have been curly-haired (people).
